Wiley：拉曼光谱杂志：目录https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/journal/10974555?af=R拉曼光谱杂志目录。最新期和 EarlyView 期的文章列表。 en-US © 约翰·威利父子有限公司wileyonlinelibrary@wiley.com（分析科学期刊） Thu, 16 Nov 2023 08:05:16 +0000 2023 年 11 月 16 日星期四 08:05:16 +0000 Atypon®文学™ https://validator.w3.org/feed/docs/rss2.html 10080 Wiley：拉曼光谱杂志：目录威利拉曼光谱杂志 Wiley：拉曼光谱杂志：目录https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/pb-assets/journal-banners/10974555.jpg https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/journal/10974555?af=R https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6623?af=R Tue, 14 Nov 2023 15:18:47 -0800 2023-11-14T03:18:47-08:00 Wiley：拉曼光谱杂志：目录 10.1002/jrs.6623使用拉曼光谱和化学计量学对冷害猕猴桃与健康猕猴桃进行鉴定和分类拉曼光谱学杂志，EarlyView。我们应用拉曼光谱结合主成分分析和分类技术（例如支持向量机、主成分分析-判别分析和偏最小二乘判别分析）来区分受冷害的猕猴桃和正常水果。模型显示出连续季节性数据的稳健性，并且 SVM 分类 (>;90%) 证明了将其用作区分水果质量的工具的巨大潜力。摘要 早期发现水果病害对于维持猕猴桃产品的稳定、高质量至关重要。冷害是猕猴桃中发现的一种生理疾病，在其达到严重阶段或果实被切开之前很难识别。考虑到这一点，拉曼光谱与化学计量学相结合，对完好和冷害的“Zesy002”猕猴桃进行了研究。我们对 2018 年和 2019 年收获的水果进行了光谱分析。根据苯丙素和糖的光谱特征分离受损和完好的水果样品。此外，还使用 ​​2018 年水果样本集使用支持向量机、主成分分析-线性判别分析和偏最小二乘-判别分析来构建、验证和测试模型。此外，考虑到测试集的准确性、敏感性和特异性，使用 2019 年水果样本集评估了模型的稳健性。开发了支持向量机模型，区分测试集水果（2018 年季节）的准确度为 93%，灵敏度为 85%，特异性为 100%。使用相同数据集构建的主成分分析-线性判别分析模型和偏最小二乘-判别分析模型分别给出了>;83%和93%的测试精度。模型对 2019 年季节的样本表现出稳健性。这项研究为利用拉曼光谱识别猕猴桃冷害的潜力提供了见解。 ;

;为了克服 SERS 技术检测乙烯利的挑战，改变了几个参数：pH、盐添加、激光线激发、时间依赖性、直接粉末溶解，以及不同类型的基材（固体和胶体分散体）。此外，还采用了理论方法（密度泛函理论和电荷辅助片段相互作用）。

;
;

;摘要

;

;乙烯利是一种广泛用于水果和蔬菜的生长调节剂，由于其毒性，需要仔细监测。然而，据我们所知，关于表面增强拉曼散射（SERS）乙烯利检测的文献中只有两篇作品。事实上，获得 SERS 信号具有挑战性。因此，我们利用理论（如密度泛函理论和电荷辅助片段相互作用）和实验方法评估了乙烯利的 SERS 信号，解决了有限的文献知识。反应位点上有 Ag 或 Au 原子的理论拉曼光谱通过 Ag;;Cl 键合表现出增强的乙烯利 SERS 信号，与实验数据一致。采用多种实验程序来获得 SERS 信号，包括 pH 变化、盐添加、激发激光线、时间依赖性和不同的 SERS 基底（银胶体和银岛膜）。添加盐 (NaCl) 改善了 SERS 信号，与 Ag 胶体聚集相关。银胶体分析显示，使用新鲜制备的银胶体+乙烯利分散液，将乙烯利粉末直接溶解在银胶体中，pH 7.0 是乙烯利检测的最佳值。只有 Ag;;Cl 带强度随时间而增强。银胶体（湿介质 - 633 nm 激光线）优于银岛膜（干介质 - 785 nm 激光线）。

;伊莎贝拉·比安奇·卡瓦略、西贝利·马丁、加布里埃尔·GB·阿尔维斯、杰奎琳·席尔瓦、奥古斯托·巴塔金·内托、卡洛斯·J·L·康斯坦丁研究文章用于乙烯利检测的表面增强拉曼散射信号的挑战：理论和实验方法10.1002/jrs.6617拉曼光谱杂志10.1002/jrs.6617 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6617?af=R 研究文章 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6616?af=R Sun, 12 Nov 2023 18:14:29 -0800 2023-11-12T06:14:29-08:00 Wiley：拉曼光谱杂志：目录 10.1002/jrs.6616光热拉曼技术测定低阶碳纤维的纵向导热系数拉曼光谱学杂志，EarlyView。本研究探讨了直径范围为 5-7 µ$$ \upmu $$ m 的人造丝基碳纤维的纵向导热系数，在 300 至 1300 K 的温度范围内进行测量。我们采用光热拉曼技术并开发了一种定制的导热系数热模型，使用 Hanckel 变换进行分析求解。这产生了一个实用公式，用于根据激光光斑通量和加热的光纤温度来确定给定温度下的纵向导热率。改进的方法根据先前在室温下使用 3-omega 方法表征的 PAN 基碳纤维的文献结果进行了验证。摘要 近年来，碳纤维（CF）在高温应用中的使用不断增加。然而，确定高温下的热性能是一项具有挑战性的任务。在这项研究中，使用光热拉曼方法检查了直径在 5–7 μ$$ \upmu $$ m 范围内的两种不同类型 CF 的热导率与温度的关系。拉曼光谱首先用于获得纤维的结构组织和结构均匀性。然后，由于拉曼光谱对激光激发功率和外部温度敏感，拉曼光谱被用作非接触式温度计来确定光纤的局部温升。通过求解圆柱形纤维的热扩散方程和一组类似于实验条件的边界条件，导出了一个公式，可以准确估计纵向导热系数。结果与声子散射理论有关，可归因于缺陷散射的综合效应。估计了辐射热损失和对流热损失，并确定了它们对热导率的影响。 ;

;卤化物钙钛矿中有机阳离子的内部振动可用于研究其晶体结构。我们研究了卤化物后钙钛矿(3cp)PbBr;3;中3-氰基吡啶鎓(3cp)阳离子的振动特性。研究发现 N-H 振动受晶体场影响最大。使用 DFT 和聚类方法对其光谱位置进行建模。

;
;

;摘要

;

;卤化物钙钛矿及其类似物中有机阳离子的内部振动可用于研究这些新型半导体材料的晶体结构。在这项工作中，我们研究了有机-无机杂化卤化物中 3-氰基吡啶鎓 (3cp;+; = [3-CN-C5H5NH];+;) 阳离子的振动性质后钙钛矿 (3cp)PbBr;3;。对于实验拉曼光谱的 DFT 建模，我们构建了三种不同的模型：游离阳离子、最小化学计量簇和纳米簇。自由阳离子的计算充分描述了大部分内部振动。为了描述高波数氢伸缩振动，首先是 N-H 振动，有必要使用足够大的团簇。我们在晶体场描述的簇方法中表明，簇中不仅需要包含卤素，还需要包含它们最近的环境。这样的话，与实验是一致的，可以对氢键的强度及其稳定晶体的作用提出进一步的考虑。

; Irina V. Krauklis、Anna Yu Samsonova、Nikita I. Selivanov、Yury V. Kapitonov、Yuri V. Chizhov研究文章杂化卤化物后钙钛矿3-氰基吡啶鎓三溴化铅中有机阳离子振动的密度泛函理论研究的簇方法10.1002/jrs.6618拉曼光谱杂志10.1002/jrs.6618 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6618?af=R 研究文章 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6619?af=R Tue, 07 Nov 2023 19:47:02 -0800 2023-11-07T07:47:02-08:00 Wiley：拉曼光谱杂志：目录 10.1002/jrs.6619通过 SERS 胶带采样快速、灵敏地检测水果表面的 2,4-二氯苯氧基乙酸残留拉曼光谱学杂志，EarlyView。本文提出了一种基于带采样表面增强拉曼光谱的简单“粘贴-收集-测试”策略。通过将胶带的柔韧性和粘度与优化的银纳米颗粒的活性相结合，实现了樱桃番茄中 2,4-二氯苯氧基乙酸的痕量检测。整个过程简单快捷。摘要 水果中残留的2,4-二氯苯氧基乙酸（2,4-D）对人类健康构成严重威胁。 2,4-D在体内持续沉积可能会引起癌症或阿尔茨海默病等症状，因此，水果中2,4-D微量的检测具有重要意义。在本文中，我们提出了一种基于通过带采样（SERS-带采样）的表面增强拉曼光谱的简单“粘贴-收集-测试”策略。商业胶带的柔韧性和粘性与优化的银纳米粒子 (Ag NP) 的优异活性相结合，可快速痕量检测樱桃番茄中的农药。前两个步骤“粘贴”和“收集”由胶带完成，以简化分析物分子的采样程序，“测试”步骤是通过在收集分析物后将Ag NPs沉积在胶带表面来完成。整个过程在几分钟内完成。结果表明，采用SERS胶带采样方法，樱桃番茄中2,4-D的检测限（LOD）为3.63 × 10−10 M，远低于欧盟规定的最大残留限量（欧洲联盟）。这种简单且易于操作的方法具有高度敏感性，可能是 2,4-D 对食品安全的承诺。 ;

;这项研究检查了拉曼光谱和 LIBS 光谱及其用于矿物定量的组合数据。尽管 LIBS 模型显示出更高的色散，但与拉曼模型相比，它们在 RMSEP 中表现出更高的精度。此外，LIBS 可有效检测极端浓度。基于谱参数的模型始终优于基于 PCA 的模型，产生更低的 RMSEP 和更高的 R2 值。值得注意的是，拉曼-LIBS 数据的结合显着改善了结果，特别是在采用高斯模型和神经网络模型时。这一进步对行星探索任务具有重要意义。

;
;

;摘要

;

;通过互补光谱技术对地质目标进行综合分析可以增强对火星上发现的矿物相的表征。毅力号火星车上的 SuperCam 仪器确实就是这种情况。在此框架中，本研究旨在评估和比较基于拉曼-LIBS（激光诱导击穿光谱）光谱数据表征碳酸盐矿物的多种机器学习技术。为此，通过以不同浓度比混合水菱镁矿和方解石来创建 Ca-Mg 预测曲线。通过拉曼光谱和 LIBS 光谱进行表征后，使用不同的多变量机器学习（高斯过程回归、支持向量机、树集成和人工神经网络）来根据各自的数据集预测每个样品的浓度比。然后将分别分析拉曼和 LIBS 数据获得的结果与组合它们获得的结果进行比较。通过比较它们的性能，这项工作表明，基于高斯和集成方法的矿物判别优化了拉曼-LIBS 数据集的组合，优于仅由拉曼和 LIBS 数据确保的结果。这表明数据组合和机器学习的融合是优化火星返回光谱数据分析的一种有前途的方法。

;索菲亚·胡尔夫·冈萨雷斯、何塞·A·曼里克、马可·维内兰达、伊万·雷耶斯·罗德里格斯、埃琳娜·帕斯夸尔·桑切斯、奥雷利奥·桑斯·阿兰斯、梅内劳斯·康斯坦蒂尼迪斯、伊曼纽尔·A·拉拉、玛丽亚·E·查罗、爱德华多·罗德里格斯·古铁斯、何塞·M·洛佩斯‐罗德里格斯、何塞·F·桑斯·雷克纳、海梅·德尔加多·伊格莱西亚斯、曼努埃尔·冈萨雷斯、费尔南多·鲁尔、吉列尔莫·洛佩斯·雷耶斯研究文章应用于组合拉曼和 LIBS 光谱的机器学习方法：对行星任务中矿物辨别的影响10.1002/jrs.6611拉曼光谱杂志10.1002/jrs.6611 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6611?af=R 研究文章 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6612?af=R Sat, 28 Oct 2023 02:34:52 -0700 2023-10-28T02:34:52-07:00 Wiley：拉曼光谱杂志：目录 10.1002/jrs.6612颜料和遮光剂的拉曼鉴定：与固态光谱方法比较的多变量分析的兴趣和局限性-II。砷基遮光剂及其与钴矿石的关系拉曼光谱学杂志，EarlyView。在 18 世纪法国和中国的珐琅工艺品中检测到与蓝色相关或无关的砷基遮光剂。最具代表性的拉曼签名与之前在“参考”阶段发布的拉曼签名进行了分类。最相关的 PCA 分类是通过利用从光谱分解中提取的参数来获得的，这允许识别至少四种类型的拉曼特征和结构。摘要 拉曼分析是一种非侵入性技术，可以通过移动系统在现场进行。然而，牙釉质中不同数量的不同晶相或无定形相（玻璃基质、遮光剂和颜料）的存在导致拉曼特征的部分观察，这些特征通常没有在文献中被表征。我们在这里研究了在 18 世纪法国和中国物品的白色、蓝色和黄/绿色珐琅中观察到的相，并比较了固态光谱方法的有效性（确定与结构相关的振动模式的参数） ）和多元化学计量方法（PCA 和层次聚类），对全局或部分光谱或从第一种方法提取的参数进行。 The incorporation of the spectra of neighbouring or similar phases from the literature into the corpus of processed data, in particular those obtained for phases that are not initially structurally characterized, is decisive for the quality of the results. At least four different lead arsenates are identified. The combination of visual observation of the peaks and multivariate analysis shows that the shape, position and area of the band associated with the main As‐O stretching vibration around 820 cm−1 vary according to several criteria related to production techniques specific to certain workshops. The contribution of multivariate analysis based on spectra alone appears to be very limited compared to the examination of spectroscopic parameters. ;

;Arsenic-based opacifiers associated or not with blue colour are detected in 18th century French and Chinese enamelled artefacts. The most representative Raman signatures were categorized with those previously published on “reference” phases. The most relevant PCA classifications are obtained by exploiting the parameters extracted from the spectral decompositions, which allow identifying at least four types of Raman signatures and structures.

;
;

;Abstract

;

;Raman analysis is a noninvasive technique that can be conducted on-site via a mobile system. However, the presence in variable quantity of different crystalline or amorphous phases (glassy matrix, opacifiers and pigments) in the enamel leads to the partial observation of Raman signatures, signatures often not being characterized in the literature. We study here the phases observed in the white, blue and yellow/green enamels of French and Chinese objects from the 18th century and compare the effectiveness of a solid-state spectroscopic approach (identification of the parameters determining the vibrational modes in relation to the structures) and the multivariate chemometric approach (PCA and Hierarchical Clustering), carried out on the global or partial spectra, or on the parameters extracted from the first approach. The incorporation of the spectra of neighbouring or similar phases from the literature into the corpus of processed data, in particular those obtained for phases that are not initially structurally characterized, is decisive for the quality of the results. At least four different lead arsenates are identified. The combination of visual observation of the peaks and multivariate analysis shows that the shape, position and area of the band associated with the main As-O stretching vibration around 820 cm;−1; vary according to several criteria related to production techniques specific to certain workshops. The contribution of multivariate analysis based on spectra alone appears to be very limited compared to the examination of spectroscopic parameters.

; Jacques Burlot, Divine Vangu, Ludovic Bellot‐Gurlet, Philippe Colomban SPECIAL ISSUE ‐ RESEARCH ARTICLE Raman identification of pigments and opacifiers: Interest and limitation of multivariate analysis by comparison with solid state spectroscopical approach—II. Arsenic‐based opacifiers and relation with cobalt ores 10.1002/jrs.6612 Journal of Raman Spectroscopy 10.1002/jrs.6612 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6612?af=R SPECIAL ISSUE ‐ RESEARCH ARTICLE https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6615?af=R Wed, 25 Oct 2023 02:13:43 -0700 2023-10-25T02:13:43-07:00 Wiley: Journal of Raman Spectroscopy: Table of Contents 10.1002/jrs.6615 Confirming the stimulated Raman origin of singlet‐oxygen photogeneration Journal of Raman Spectroscopy, EarlyView. We demonstrate the stimulated Raman character of laser photogeneration of singlet oxygen in a water environment. We compare the singlet oxygen Stokes to the Stokes signals corresponding to the solvent vibrational modes. Both signals exhibit similar pumping wavelength dependence, temporal and pump power dependences, and nonlinear refraction effect characteristics of stimulated Raman signals. We show that the singlet oxygen Stokes response strongly depends on the solvent's oxygen concentration and is independent of the solvent type. Abstract We confirm the Raman origin of the singlet oxygen photogenerated in water environments without using photosensitizers. Nanosecond light pulses in the blue region of the spectra (405–480 nm) generate Raman Stokes excitation of singlet oxygen in the red region (600–670 nm) when focusing on pure distilled water. The excitation also produces Stokes components corresponding to the stretching modes of water molecules. The time evolution of both types of Stokes components, singlet oxygen, and stretching modes correspond to the time duration of the excitation pulse as expected for a Raman process. Their power dependences are also similar. Finally, both signals exhibit high refractive ring structures due to the nonlinear optical interaction generated by the stimulated Raman process. ;

;We demonstrate the stimulated Raman character of laser photogeneration of singlet oxygen in a water environment. We compare the singlet oxygen Stokes to the Stokes signals corresponding to the solvent vibrational modes. Both signals exhibit similar pumping wavelength dependence, temporal and pump power dependences, and nonlinear refraction effect characteristics of stimulated Raman signals. We show that the singlet oxygen Stokes response strongly depends on the solvent's oxygen concentration and is independent of the solvent type.

;
;

;Abstract

;

;We confirm the Raman origin of the singlet oxygen photogenerated in water environments without using photosensitizers. Nanosecond light pulses in the blue region of the spectra (405–480 nm) generate Raman Stokes excitation of singlet oxygen in the red region (600–670 nm) when focusing on pure distilled water. The excitation also produces Stokes components corresponding to the stretching modes of water molecules. The time evolution of both types of Stokes components, singlet oxygen, and stretching modes correspond to the time duration of the excitation pulse as expected for a Raman process. Their power dependences are also similar. Finally, both signals exhibit high refractive ring structures due to the nonlinear optical interaction generated by the stimulated Raman process.

; Aristides Marcano Olaizola, Ameen Zerrad, Fahim Janneto, David H. Kingsley RESEARCH ARTICLE Confirming the stimulated Raman origin of singlet‐oxygen photogeneration 10.1002/jrs.6615 Journal of Raman Spectroscopy 10.1002/jrs.6615 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6615?af=R RESEARCH ARTICLE https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6606?af=R Wed, 25 Oct 2023 01:05:22 -0700 2023-10-25T01:05:22-07:00 Wiley: Journal of Raman Spectroscopy: Table of Contents 10.1002/jrs.6606 DNA i‐motif formation at physiological pH revealed by Raman spectroscopy Journal of Raman Spectroscopy, EarlyView. We apply off‐resonant and UV‐resonant Raman spectroscopies to study i‐motif (iM) formation of the model C rich sequence (C9T3)3C9 at neutral pH. We show that different iM species with different thermal stability and different time kinetics are formed depending on the temperature. SVD analysis demonstrates that the studied sequence adopts (at each time and temperature) a variable proportion of disordered and perfectly ordered iM forms. Abstract The intercalated motif (iM) is a four‐stranded structure consisting of two parallel homoduplexes formed by hemiprotonated C.C+ pairs and intercalated antiparallel to each other. iM is generally formed at acidic pH, as cytosine protonation is required for its formation. However, sequences with long cytosine tracts can form iM at physiological pH conditions. Here, we use both off‐resonant Raman and UV‐resonant Raman (using synchrotron radiation) spectroscopy (RS) to study the sequence (C9T3)3C9, which has been recently thoroughly analysed by other spectroscopic methods (CD, 1H NMR). In line with these methods, RS has shown that (C9T3)3C9 adopts iM at neutral pH and the iM forms with slow kinetics, melts in multiple steps and exhibits a large thermal hysteresis between the folding and refolding processes. The presence of isosbestic points in the temperature‐dependent Raman spectra (in line with the SVD analysis indicating just two independent spectral components) suggests that the (C9T3)3C9 is found as a mixture of disordered and ordered structures, the proportion of which is temperature dependent. The ordered iM species are believed to be composed of the same type of C.C+ pairs but differing in their number and arrangement along the cytosine tracts. The related sequence (C9A3)3C9 shows the same behaviour as (C9T3)3C9, indicating that the substitution of adenine bases for thymine bases has little effect. ;

;We apply off-resonant and UV-resonant Raman spectroscopies to study i-motif (iM) formation of the model C rich sequence (C;9;T;3;);3;C;9; at neutral pH. We show that different iM species with different thermal stability and different time kinetics are formed depending on the temperature. SVD analysis demonstrates that the studied sequence adopts (at each time and temperature) a variable proportion of disordered and perfectly ordered iM forms.

;
;

;Abstract

;

;The intercalated motif (iM) is a four-stranded structure consisting of two parallel homoduplexes formed by hemiprotonated CC;+; pairs and intercalated antiparallel to each other. iM is generally formed at acidic pH, as cytosine protonation is required for its formation. However, sequences with long cytosine tracts can form iM at physiological pH conditions. Here, we use both off-resonant Raman and UV-resonant Raman (using synchrotron radiation) spectroscopy (RS) to study the sequence (C;9;T;3;);3;C;9;, which has been recently thoroughly analysed by other spectroscopic methods (CD, ;1;H NMR). In line with these methods, RS has shown that (C;9;T;3;);3;C;9; adopts iM at neutral pH and the iM forms with slow kinetics, melts in multiple steps and exhibits a large thermal hysteresis between the folding and refolding processes. The presence of isosbestic points in the temperature-dependent Raman spectra (in line with the SVD analysis indicating just two independent spectral components) suggests that the (C;9;T;3;);3;C;9; is found as a mixture of disordered and ordered structures, the proportion of which is temperature dependent. The ordered iM species are believed to be composed of the same type of CC;+; pairs but differing in their number and arrangement along the cytosine tracts. The related sequence (C;9;A;3;);3;C;9; shows the same behaviour as (C;9;T;3;);3;C;9;, indicating that the substitution of adenine bases for thymine bases has little effect.

; Jan Palacký, Petra Školáková, Daniel Renčiuk, Peter Mojzeš, Barbara Rossi, Fatima Matroodi, Michaela Vorlíčková RESEARCH ARTICLE DNA i‐motif formation at physiological pH revealed by Raman spectroscopy 10.1002/jrs.6606 Journal of Raman Spectroscopy 10.1002/jrs.6606 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6606?af=R RESEARCH ARTICLE https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6614?af=R Fri, 20 Oct 2023 00:44:42 -0700 2023-10-20T12:44:42-07:00 Wiley: Journal of Raman Spectroscopy: Table of Contents 10.1002/jrs.6614 GeoRaman 2022 Journal of Raman Spectroscopy, EarlyView. Adam Culka, Jan Jehlička SPECIAL ISSUE ‐ EDITORIAL GeoRaman 2022 10.1002/jrs.6614 Journal of Raman Spectroscopy 10.1002/jrs.6614 https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6614?af=R SPECIAL ISSUE ‐ EDITORIAL https://analyticalsciencejournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6608?af=R Wed, 18 Oct 2023 05:08:52 -0700 2023-10-18T05:08:52-07:00 Wiley: Journal of Raman Spectroscopy: Table of Contents 10.1002/jrs.6608 A machine learning approach for the automated classification of bulk sp2 and sp3 carbon materials Journal of Raman Spectroscopy, EarlyView. Carbon materials present unique Raman signatures that depend on various factors, including predominant carbon hybridization. Reference spectra from a variety of carbon materials were obtained and used as a training set for a machine learning algorithm. The procedure allowed the automated classification of a library of Raman spectra reported in the literature with high accuracy (97%). Abstract Principal component analysis (PCA) and linear discriminant analysis (LDA) were used to classify different types of carbon material based on their Raman spectra. The selected reference materials were highly oriented pyrolytic graphite (HOPG), diamond‐like carbon (DLC), glassy carbon (GC), hydrogenated graphite‐like carbon (GLCH), and hydrogenated polymer‐like carbon (PLCH). These materials vary in crystallinity, predominant carbon hybridization, and hydrogen content. The training dataset was Raman spectra collected from commercial samples (HOPG, DLC, GC) and samples synthesized in our laboratory (GLCH, PLCH). The Raman spectra were collected using 532 nm laser excitation. The classification model revealed that the first principal component (PC1) was the determinant source of information to separate the crystalline from the amorphous carbon samples. PC2 allowed the separation of amorphous material with different levels of hybridization (sp2 and sp3). Finally, both PC2 and PC3 contributed to separate materials with different levels of hydrogenation. The classification model was tested using a library of Raman spectra of carbon materials reported in the literature, and the results showed a high accuracy prediction (97%). The model presented here provides an avenue for automated classification of carbon materials using Raman spectroscopy and machine learning. ;

;Carbon materials present unique Raman signatures that depend on various factors, including predominant carbon hybridization. Reference spectra from a variety of carbon materials were obtained and used as a training set for a machine learning algorithm. The procedure allowed the automated classification of a library of Raman spectra reported in the literature with high accuracy (97%).

;
;

;Abstract

;

;Principal component analysis (PCA) and linear discriminant analysis (LDA) were used to classify different types of carbon material based on their Raman spectra. The selected reference materials were highly oriented pyrolytic graphite (HOPG), diamond-like carbon (DLC), glassy carbon (GC), hydrogenated graphite-like carbon (GLCH), and hydrogenated polymer-like carbon (PLCH). These materials vary in crystallinity, predominant carbon hybridization, and hydrogen content. The training dataset was Raman spectra collected from commercial samples (HOPG, DLC, GC) and samples synthesized in our laboratory (GLCH, PLCH). The Raman spectra were collected using 532 nm laser excitation. The classification model revealed that the first principal component (PC1) was the determinant source of information to separate the crystalline from the amorphous carbon samples. PC2 allowed the separation of amorphous material with different levels of hybridization (sp;2; and sp;3;). Finally, both PC2 and PC3 contributed to separate materials with different levels of hydrogenation. The classification model was tested using a library of Raman spectra of carbon materials reported in the literature, and the results showed a high accuracy prediction (97%). The model presented here provides an avenue for automated classification of carbon materials using Raman spectroscopy and machine learning.

; Bruno G. daFonseca, Sapanbir S. Thind, Ian Booth, Alexandre G.
